headline.main: Sleep Is Linked to Heart Attack; SLEEP IS LINKED TO HEART ATTACK

docs.abstract: Amer Cancer Soc 6-yr study cites cigarette smoking as most important cause of heart disease and stroke; repts men, between ages 40 and 49, who smoked 40 or more cigarettes a day suffered 5 1/2 times as many heart attacks as nonsmokers; finds 2 times as many men who smoked 20 or more cigarettes a day died from stroke as did nonsmokers; chart
docs.lead_paragraph: A person who sleeps 10 or more hours a night may be snoozing his way into a heart attack or stroke, according to a six-year study of almost 800,000 men and women conducted by the American Cancer Society.
docs.snippet: A person who sleeps 10 or more hours a night may be snoozing his way into a heart attack or stroke, according to a six-year study of almost 800,000 men and women conducted by the American Cancer Society.
